articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's elite Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) has ordered all members to stop using any type of communication devices after thousands of pagers and walkie-talkies used by its Hezbollah allies in Lebanon blew up in deadly attacks last week, two senior Iranian security officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran's Guards ban communications devices after strike on Hezbollah, security officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Monday it was conducting extensive strikes against targets of the Iranian-backed Hezbollah movement in Lebanon, which come amid some of the heaviest cross-border exchanges of fire in nearly a year of conflict.
articles.title: Israeli military says it is striking Hezbollah targets in Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican Donald Trump said that he will not make a fourth consecutive run for the U.S. presidency if he loses the Nov. 5 election, saying "that will be it" in an interview released on Sunday.
articles.title: Trump says he will not run again if he loses in November, 'that will be it'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel is examining a plan to use siege tactics against Hamas in northern Gaza, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was quoted by several Israeli media outlets as saying on Sunday.
articles.title: Netanyahu examining siege plan for Hamas in north Gaza, Israeli media report

articles.author: Simon Jessop, Valerie Volcovici
articles.description: A marathon week of climate change meetings opened in New York on Sunday, with celebrities and world leaders mingling with corporate leaders over talks on how to drive climate action forward.
articles.title: Leaders at climate change meetings in New York warn of growing mistrust between nations

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's Social Democrats (SPD) staved off the far-right in a regional election on Sunday, likely providing him only a brief reprieve from growing criticism of his leadership within his own party.
articles.title: Regional victory brings Germany's Scholz brief respite from growing pressure within party

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rescuers evacuated residents from several damaged apartment buildings.
articles.title: Sixteen civilians injured in Russian attack on Zaporizhzhia, Ukrainian officials say

articles.author: Louis Van Boxel-Woolf
articles.description: The government that takes power in Austria after next Sunday's general election will face growing pressure to diversify its energy supply away from dependence on Russian gas, just as the economy is stuck in reverse gear.
articles.title: Austria election brings into focus Russian gas habit and a sputtering economy

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is expected to meet Vietnam's President and ruling Communist Party Chief To Lam on Wednesday, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Biden expected to meet Vietnamese president on Wednesday, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has arrived in New York to attend sessions at the U.N. General Assembly, the Ukrinform state news agency reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Zelenskiy arrives in New York for UN meetings, Ukrinform says
